results.title: Shelf Life: Our Collections and the Passage of Time
results.abstract: Set off by a scene in a movie, a critic reflects on cultural baggage: “The things you loved when you were young will never be able to make you young again.”
results.byline: By A.O. Scott and Daniel Arnold

results.title: The Oscars’ Popularity Crisis
results.abstract: Why academy efforts like trimming awards from the telecast won’t help. People watch because it’s a show about elite work, not in spite of it.

results.title: Restoring ‘The Godfather’ to Its Original (Still Dark) Glory
results.abstract: Francis Ford Coppola discusses a repaired 50th-anniversary edition of his classic, one that aims to be as vivid — and shadowy — as it was in 1972.

multimedia.caption: Marlon Brando in the opening scene of “The Godfather.” Stains, tears and other flaws in the film have been fixed for the new edition.

results.title: Husband of Slain Cinematographer Was ‘Just So Angry’ at Alec Baldwin
results.abstract: Matthew Hutchins, the widower of Halyna Hutchins, says in an upcoming “Today” show interview that it was “absurd” for Mr. Baldwin to deny responsibility in the fatal shooting.

multimedia.caption: Matthew Hutchins, whose wife, Halyna, was killed on the set of “Rust” last year, spoke about the shooting in an interview with Hoda Kotb for NBC’s “Today” show.

results.title: Bappi Lahiri, India’s ‘Disco King,’ Dies at 69
results.abstract: He helped popularize the genre with some of the country’s biggest hits of all time, including “I Am a Disco Dancer.”

multimedia.caption: Bappi Lahiri in 2011 at his home in Mumbai. He grew up idolizing Elvis for his style and ultimately became known for his own flair — tinted sunglasses, shiny jackets and mounds of gold jewelry.
multimedia.copyright: Anshuman Poyrekar/Hindustan Times via Getty Images

results.title: Sally Kellerman, Oscar-Nominated ‘MASH’ Actress, Is Dead at 84
results.abstract: Ms. Kellerman, who became a star in Robert Altman’s dark satire, was known for her self-effacing comedy, a velvety voice and an ability to toggle between sultry and silly.
results.byline: By Christine Chung and Neil Genzlinger

multimedia.caption: Sally Kellerman at the 1989 Cannes Film Festival. In a memoir, she recalled wanting to be a performer from an early age: “I must have come out of the womb singing and acting.”
